etymology.description: semantic: 彳 'walk' + 止 'foot; to stop' (conservative form 𣥆; bottom now stylized as 龰).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the step radical 彳 with 止 to depict movement and pausing, conveying the idea of walking or going. The older form 𣥆 made the foot shape explicit, later stylized to 龰 in the modern component form.
etymology.simplification: Standardized in Simplified Chinese as 辶 by adopting the cursive form of the lower 龰, reducing strokes for a frequently used radical component.

examples.chinese: 游客经过古桥(遊客經過古橋)。
examples.english: Tourists pass over an old bridge.
